intro: Moraea papilionacea subsp. glabrescens, commonly known as the glabrous moraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, butterfly-shaped flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its smooth, glabrous leaves and stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant, showy blooms.
